meanings.definition: The act of buying and selling goods for profit.
meanings.sent1: Merchanting can be a lucrative way to make money.
meanings.sent2: In the market, merchanting is a common practice.
meanings.sent3: The town's annual fair was filled with merchanting, as vendors sold their wares.
meanings.sent4: Her skill in merchanting was like a well-oiled machine, always turning a profit.
meanings.sent5: The art of merchanting requires a keen eye for good deals.

meanings.sent1: His family has been in merchanting for generations.
meanings.sent2: The success of the town relied heavily on merchanting.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think of itself as a merchanting expert, always carrying around random objects.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, merchanting is a cornerstone of the economy.
meanings.sent5: The history books are filled with tales of famous merchanting families.

meanings.definition: The practice of engaging in trade as a business.
meanings.sent1: Merchanting requires a good understanding of market trends.
meanings.sent2: The art of merchanting has been passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The penguins at the zoo seemed to be merchanting with each other, swapping fish for shiny pebbles.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, the streets were alive with the sounds of merchanting.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur was eager to learn the ropes of merchanting.
